metadata.title: CVE-2024-47749 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/cxgb4: Added NULL check for lookup_atidThe lookup_atid() function can return NULL if the ATID isinvalid or does not exist in the identifier table, whichcould lead to dereferencing a null pointer without acheck in the `act_establish()` and `act_open_rpl()` functions.Add a NULL check to prevent null pointer dereferencing.Found by Linux Verification Center (linuxtesting.org) with SVACE.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
